entries.meaning: (uncountable) The trade or craft of a saddler.
examples: A good deal of dressed leather is now sent to London, from whence formerly much of what was used here was brought. Saddlery is carried on to some extent.

entries.meaning: A place of business of a saddler.
examples: There is a tinker’s shop and a pharmacy; a saddlery, where the broken gear used in cultivating the monastery lands is mended  […]

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The inventory and equipment of a saddler; saddles and other horse-riding equipment, or the materials for making them.
examples: The next article, and the most important article of all to this country, was saddlery. This embraced every part of the leather manufacture, boots, shoes, gloves, &c.
